intro: Leichhardtia divisicola, commonly known as the narrow-leaf leichhardtia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and produces small, white or pinkish flowers. It is typically found in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Leichhardtia divisicola is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and adaptability to dry conditions.
